oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Mary Coleman to Gov. Buford Ellington
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Handwritten letter to Gov. Ellington asking him to prevent Highlander Folk School from rechartering in Knox County. She claims it will be a "hotbed of subversion" and a danger to Alcoa aluminum plant and Oak Ridge. She also believed it would be a "great source of agitation" at Knoxville College, led by Rev. Frank Gordon. Coleman then repeats hearsay that Highlander is a secret Communist training facility.

Rev. Frank Gordon was a minister and Civil Rights leader in Knoxville, Tennessee, as well as president of the Tennessee Chapter of the NAACP. He preached at Shiloh Presbyterian Church in Knoxville for 23 years and led many Civil Rights demonstrations across the city. He died in 2006.
